async-configuration.title: Async Configuration
async-configuration.description: To provide asynchronous mongoose schema options (similar to nestjs mongoose implementation) you can use the TypegooseModule.forRootAsync

discriminators.title: Mongoose Discriminators
discriminators.description: To add discriminators to a model, you may specify a discriminators array in the long-form options shown below.

install.title: Installation
install.description: This assumes you have a nestjs project to work with. If you don't I recommend that you use nestjs cli to jump start an example to project to get started using nestjs-typegoose.

multiple-connections.title: Multiple MongoDB Connections
multiple-connections.description: To have multiple MongoDB connections one needs to add a connectionName string to forRoot and forFeature.

schema-options.title: Schema Options
schema-options.description: To add custom mongoose schema options you can simply change Typegoose.forFeature to the following format:

testing.title: Testing
testing.description: Like @nestjs/mongoose (see the testing section) nestjs-typegoose's forFeature and forRoot rely on a database connection to work. To unit test your CatService without connecting to a mongo database you need to create a fake model using a custom provider.

usage.title: Basic Usage
usage.description: Check out this example project if you need help.
